intro: Rhaponticoides gokceoglui, commonly known as the Turkish rhubarb, is a flowering plant native to Turkey. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants known for their distinctive leaf shapes and edible rhubarb species. The plant features upright, branched stems and lance-shaped leaves with a reddish tint. Its flowers are small and clustered in panicles, typically appearing in late spring. It is valued for its ornamental qualities and has been studied for its potential medicinal properties.
